Detailed Description

Every editor has an Editor-Document, which contains one or more compound items. Every compound item may contain a variable number of Items (an Item is an instance of the class AtomItem), like e. g. characters or bitmaps). An Editor-Document has the property to be obtainable when beeing shared between several objects.
See also:
CompoundItem

AtomItem

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum EditorDocument::LineAlignment
 

Enumerator:
DefaultAlign  compound items are aligned corresponding to the used language (usually this means left-aligned).
LeftAlign  compound items are aligned left.
CenteredAlign  compound items are horizontally centered.
RightAlign  compound items are aligned right.

enum EditorDocument::WrapPolicy
 

Enumerator:
WhitespaceWrap  Wrapping is done on white-spaces. If there is no whitespace before the wrapping edge, the word might get splitted. The wrapping is done in a way, that every character is fully visible at the end of a line. WhitespaceWrap is the default wrapping method when editing texts.
StrictWhitespaceWrap  Behaves the same as WhitespaceWrap, but the wrapping is done strictly on whitespaces and hence no word is splitted.
LeftJustifiedWrap  Wrapping is done on white-spaces. In opposite to WhitespaceWrap white spaces at the end of a line may be clipped. Hence no line starts with a white-space and leads to a left-justified layout. LeftJustifiedWrap is recommended for read-only documents. When using LeftJustifiedWrap for editing a text, than the situation is possible that the caret disappears out of the visible area when adding a lot of whitespaces.
CutWrap  Wrapping is done after the first partly visible character at the end of a line.
CompactWrap  The wrapping is done in a way that no character will get clipped at the end of a line. No differentiation is done between whitespaces and other characters. This leads to a very compact layout for e. g. small areas, but usually leads to cutted words.

INT EditorDocument::GetCompoundItemCount (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns the number of compound items of the document. Every document contains at least one compound item (= 1 is the default return-value).

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditorDocument.

virtual INT EditorDocument::GetItemCount (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Returns the number of Items of the document.

Implemented in MultiMediaEditorDocument, DateEditorDocument, TextEditorDocument, and TimeEditorDocument.

void EditorDocument::GetItemScope (  INT  item_index,
INT  count,
INT  sub_index,
XYDIM *  x,
XYDIM *  width
)  const [virtual]
 

Returns the x-position and width of an item, which is part of the line specified by item_index and count. The default-implementation is suitable for documents, which don't contain a bidi-text inside the line.

Parameters:
item_index Index of the item, where the line starts.
count Number of items in the line.
sub_index Index relative to item_index, which indicates the item.
x Output parameter which contains the x-position of the item.
width Output parameter which contains the width of the item.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditorDocument, and TextEditorDocument.

INT  count
)  const [virtual]
 

Parameters:
item_index Index of the item, where the line starts.
count Number of items in the line.
Returns:

virtual INT EditorDocument::GetMaxItemCount (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Returns the maximum number of Items which can be inserted into the document. -1 is returned, if there is no limit.

const CompoundItem & EditorDocument::GetParentCompoundItem (  INT  item_index,
INT *  start_item_index = 0
)  const
 

Returns the parent compound item of the item with the index item_index.

Parameters:
item_index Index of the item, which is part of the parent compound item.
start_item_index Output parameter, which contains the index of the first item of the compound item compared to all items of the document.

BOOLEAN EditorDocument::InsertCompoundItem (  CompoundItem *  compound_item,
INT  ci_index = -1
)  [virtual]
 

Inserts a compound item, which has to be created by CompoundItem::CreateInstance(), into the document. The document takes care about splitting, merging and deleting compound items by CompoundItem::ReleaseInstance(), hence the pointer to every passed compound item might be invalid after invoking InsertCompoundItem (e. g. when inserting the content of the compound item might be merged to the previous compound item and the inserted compound item will be deleted immediatly). Note that the default-implementation of the class EditorDocument does not allow to insert any kind of compound item. In this case FALSE is returned (= default return-value) and the compound item is deleted immediatly.

Parameters:
compound_item Compound-item, which should be inserted.
ci_index Index of the compound item, which will be the successor of the compound item compound_item. If the index is smaller than 0, the compound item will be appended at the end of the document.
Returns:
TRUE, if the insert-process has been successful.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditorDocument.

BOOLEAN EditorDocument::InsertCompoundItemBeforeItem (  CompoundItem *  compound_item,
INT  item_index = -1
)  [virtual]
 

Inserts a compound item into the document. In opposite to InsertCompoundItem the compound item can be inserted before a variable item, not only before a compound item. The document takes care about splitting, merging and deleting compound items by CompoundItem::ReleaseInstance(), hence the pointer to every passed compound item might be invalid after invoking InsertCompoundItemBeforeItem (e. g. when inserting the content of the compound item might be merged to the previous compound item and the inserted compound item will be deleted immediatly). Note that the default-implementation of the class EditorDocument does not allow to insert any kind of compound item. In this case FALSE is returned (= default return-value) and the compound item is deleted immediatly.

Parameters:
compound_item Compound item, which should be inserted.
item_index Index of the item, which will be the successor of the compound item comp_item. If the index is smaller than 0, the compound item will be appended at the end of the compound item.
Returns:
TRUE, if the insert-process has been successful.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditorDocument.

virtual BOOLEAN EditorDocument::InsertItem (  const AtomItem &  item,
INT  item_index = -1
)  [pure virtual]
 

Inserts the item item before the item with the index item_index. The document takes care to copy the item by either cloning it or copying its content into the corresponding compound item. Hence the Item may be allocated on the stack (e. g. EditorDocument::InsertItem(CharItem(L'A'), 5); is allowed).

Implemented in MultiMediaEditorDocument, DateEditorDocument, TextEditorDocument, and TimeEditorDocument.

BOOLEAN EditorDocument::IsEditableAfterLastItem (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns:
TRUE, if editing after the last item of the document is allowed. Per default TRUE is returned.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditorDocument.

BOOLEAN EditorDocument::IsRightToLeftItem (  INT  item_index  )  const [virtual]
 

Returns TRUE, if the item with the index item_index should be treated as right-to-left-item (e. g. an arabic letter). The information might be useful for displaying the caret. Per default FALSE is returned.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditorDocument, and TextEditorDocument.

void EditorDocument::OnChangedLayout (  const Vector< EditorLine > &  line,
INT  from = -1,
INT  count = 0
)  [virtual]
 

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditorDocument.

BOOLEAN EditorDocument::RemoveCompoundItem (  INT  ci_index = -1  )  [virtual]
 

Removes the compound item with the given index. Note that not all implementations of the class EditorDocument allow a variable number of compound items. Per default, FALSE is returned.

Parameters:
ci_index Index of the compound item, which should be removed. If the index is smaller than 0, the last compound item will be deleted.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditorDocument.

virtual BOOLEAN EditorDocument::RemoveItem (  INT  item_index = -1  )  [pure virtual]
 

Removes the Item with the index item_index.

Implemented in MultiMediaEditorDocument, DateEditorDocument, TextEditorDocument, and TimeEditorDocument.

virtual BOOLEAN EditorDocument::ReplaceItem (  const AtomItem &  item,
INT  item_index = -1
)  [pure virtual]
 

Replaces the Item with the index item_index by the item item. The document takes care to copy the item by either cloning it or copying it's content into the corresponding compound item. Hence the Item may be allocated on the stack (e. g. EditorDocument::ReplaceItem(CharItem(L'A'), 5); is allowed).

Implemented in MultiMediaEditorDocument, DateEditorDocument, TextEditorDocument, and TimeEditorDocument.

void EditorDocument::SetAlphabet (  InputMapper::Alphabet  alphabet  )  [inline]
 

Sets the alphabet corresponding to 3GPP TS 23038 V430 (2001-09).

virtual INT EditorDocument::WrapLine (  INT  item_index,
XYDIM  width,
WrapPolicy  wrap_policy = WhitespaceWrap
)  const [pure virtual]
 

Wraps the line starting from the index item_index into the available width width with the wrap policy wrap_policy and returns the number of items which fit into the available width.

Implemented in MultiMediaEditorDocument, DateEditorDocument, TextEditorDocument, and TimeEditorDocument.
